result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrios G Itsines was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: with 11 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.
First 6 months straight time, remainder can be with Huber and Day Reporting Center.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetrios G Itsines

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetrios G Itsines in court with attorney David J. Lang.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 11 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.  First 6 months straight time, remainder can be with Huber and Day Reporting Center.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- 100 hours of community service
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

  Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Demetrios G Itsines in court with attorney David J. Lang.  Katherine Seelow for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Demetrios G Itsines in court with attorney David J. Lang.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Demetrios G Itsines in court with attorney David J. Lang.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Demetrios G Itsines in court with attorney David J. Lang.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney David J. Lang in court, defendant Demetrios G Itsines not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demetrios G Itsines in court with attorney David J. Lang.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 22.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.
Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment and Scheduling Conference on 8/13/15 at 8:30 am, Branch 22.

Absolute sobriety.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a valid license.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Demetrios G Itsines in court with attorney David J. Lang.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. As of August 1, 2015 case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/27/15 @ 1:30 pm
